text: That which hath made them drunk hath made me bold What hath quench'd them hath given me fire. Hark! Peace!
Well, we will have such a prologue; and it shall be written in eight and six.
Look here, upon this picture, and on this, The counterfeit presentment of two brothers. See, what a grace was seated on this brow;
I would not hear your enemy say so, Nor shall you do mine ear that violence, To make it truster of your own report Against yourself: I know you are no truant.

An earnest conjuration from the king, As England was his faithful tributary, As love between them like the palm might flourish, As peace should stiff her wheaten garland wear And stand a comma 'tween their amities, And many such-like.

Under the greenwood tree Who loves to lie with me, And turn his merry note Unto the sweet bird's throat, Come hither, come hither, come hither: Here shall he see No enemy But winter and rough weather.
